clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Life in Vaginal Aplasia Patients After Davydov Procedure
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing Quality of Life and Sexual Function in Vaginal Aplasia Patients After Neovaginal Surgical Procedure by Davydov Method

lead_sponsor.agency: School of Medicine - Vietnam National University at Ho Chi Minh city

collaborator.agency: University of Medicine and Pharmacy at Ho Chi Minh City

clinical_study.source: School of Medicine - Vietnam National University at Ho Chi Minh city

brief_summary.textblock: Mayer-Rokitansky-Kuster-Hauser(MRKH) syndrome is described as absence or underdevelopment of vagina and uterus. This condition is extremely rare congenital malformation that affects one in every 5000 female births. Medical management of MRKH syndrome includes the creation of a neovagina using nonsurgical or surgical procedure. In Vietnam, since 2014, Davydov technique has been used to create neovagina for patients with MRKH syndrome at Tu Du hospital which is the biggest obstetric and gynecological hospital in south of Vietnam. However, the effectiveness of this surgical approach on patient's life and sexual activity hasn't been assessed. The objective of this study is to assess the quality of life, the psychological impact and the sexual function of Vietnamese women with MRKH syndrome after Davydov surgical procedure.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will be conducted at Tu Du hospital, Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam. Female patients who was diagnosed as Mayer-Rokitansky-Kuster-Hauser (MRKH) syndrome were performed Davydov procedure to create neovagina at department of Anaesthesia and Intensive care, Tu Du hospital. Based on data of department of Anaesthesia and Intensive care, a list of potentially eligible patients who underwent Davydov surgery at least 6 months was made. According this list, patients will be contacted by telephone or email to set up an appointment at Tu Du hospital to assess the effectiveness of Davydov procedure which based on anatomy and function of neovagina. On appointment day, paticipants will be provided a copy of informed consent documents. Written informed consent is going to be obtained by the investigator from all women before the enrolment. Because MRKH syndrome is a rare condition, so the investigators take all patients who are suitable to inclusion criteria and accept to participate our research.
Efficacy of Davydov procedure according to anatomy aspect: the obstetric and gynecologic doctors assess the length and diameter of neovagina through gynecological examine.
Efficacy of Davydov procedure according to functional aspect: the psycological doctors assess the impact of patient's neovagina on life and sexual function through questionnaires involving World Health Organization Quality of life Scale (WHOQoL-BREF), Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI), Beck depression inventory (BDI) and self-composed qualitative questionnaire. The interview with patient will be held individually and conducted by psychological doctor. The paticipants will be requested to record the conversation.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life of women with vaginal agenesis after Davydov procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: From six months after surgery up to the initiation of the study, assessed up to 2 months
primary_outcome.description: The psychological doctor uses the questionnaire named World Health Organization Quality of Life Scale(WHOQoL-BREF) in the interview to ask patient. The patient's Quality of Life will be assessed based on the WHOQoL-BREF questionnaire 's score. All the results will be collected and calculated subsequently. The raw scores are converted to transformation scores. The first transformation converts scores to range of 4-20 and the second transformation converts domain scores to 0-100 scale. Higher scores reflect better Quality of Life.

primary_outcome.measure: Sexual Function of women with vaginal agenesis after Davydov procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: From six months after surgery up to the initiation of the study, assessed up to 2 months
primary_outcome.description: The psychological doctor uses the questionnaire named Female Sexual Function Index Scale (FSFI) in the interview to ask patient. The patient's sexual function will be assessed based on the FSFI questionnaire 's score. All the results will be collected and calculated subsequently. The FSFI's minimum total score is 2 and the FSFI's maximum total score is 36. The patient is diagnosed to have sexual dysfunction when the FSFI's total score is less than 26,55.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of depression on women with vaginal agenesis after Davydov procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From six months after surgery up to the initiation of the study, assessed up to 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: The patient will be requested to self-complete the Beck depression inventory (BDI-a tool to assess depression). All the results will be collected and calculated subsequently.The BDI's minimum total score is 0 and the BDI's maximum total score is 63. The patient is diagnosed depression when the BDI's score is greater than 14.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From six months after surgery up to the initiation of the study, assessed up to 2 months
secondary_outcome.description: The patient's neo-vagina will be measured by obstetric and gynecologic doctor. The value is estimated in centimeter.

biospec_descr.textblock: Vaginal discharge will be collected and screened under microscope to determine the inflammation of vagina.

study_pop.textblock: Sample is patients who underwent Davydov procedure to create neovagina at Tu Du hospital, Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged equal or more than 18.
- Diagnosed vaginal agenesis and underwent Davydov procedure to create neovagina at least 6 months.
- Able to listen, understand and answer questions.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Disagreed to participate the research.
- Having any conditions that make patient unable to listen, understand and answer questions.
- Having psychological disturbance.

overall_official.affiliation: University of Medicine and Pharmacy at Ho Chi Minh City

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: School of Medicine - Vietnam National University at Ho Chi Minh city
